title: (x) classic serif face in resume - Monotype Garamond {Mark S}
content:
Attaching a section of a resume example.   
   
Thanks! ![Would like to ID the font in this resume](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107113304im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24229.gif)

 [‹ (x) infographiste - Ito {Kemi}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107113304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2715 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Discoveries dreams lifestyle - Myriad {Adriano S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107113304/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2734 "Go to next forum topic")
author: link

comments.content: It's a little tricky to say for sure given the low resolution, but it looks like [Monotype Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107113304/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=205302) to me.

I'm going to guess [Monotype Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107113304/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/garamond/mt/charmap.html), or Linotype [Garamond Classico](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107113304/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/garamond-classico/garamondclassico/charmap.html), based on the Q and the closed 4. The sample is too small to see enough detail

Thank you very much!   
Best, linda
